main.name: Jackson LeMasters
main.bio: My name is Jackson LeMasters. I am currently a graduate from the University of Denverâ€™s Full Stack Developer Bootcamp. Previously, I was a student at University of Northern Colorado working toward a history degree, working part time jobs to get through college. COVID changed that plan and subsequently led me to explore a career in web development. While still fairly new to web development, I believe I am a quick learner and I have acquired a passion for building applications and websites. I enjoy using HTML, CSS and JavaScript, however I also have experience with Node.js, Express.js, Git, Github, MySQL, MongoDB, Bootstrap and React. I realize being an experienced web developer encompasses a need for continued learning, and I look forward to the journey ahead. At the end of October, I will have credentials as a Full Stack Developer, and am currently searching for a job that will allow me to utilize my skills, while gaining the real-world experience necessary to grow personally and professionally.
main.contactmessage: Please contact me through email, LinkedIn, a phone-call, or this form!

resume.skillmessage: * Each skill level is weighted with 100% being fully confident, 0% being no experience/no confidence.

education.description: Coursework Included: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, Express.js, Handlebars, React.js, Node.js, Database Theory, MongoDB, MySQL, Git

education.degree: 4 years: History Secondary Education, Political Sciences
education.description: Coursework Included: Researching historical topics and writing research papers. Researching mainly on European history, would commonly be required to read books, reports, other reasearch papers, to help build a powerful argument in my research assignments.

work.title: Web Developer
work.description: Create and maintain Wordpress website and plugins. Research and develop content for websites, and provide general IT help. Main Project: Immigration Dashboard website, helping individuals immigrate to the United States.

projects.title: Work Day Scheduler
projects.info: Work day scheduler application built using HTML, CSS, jQuery

projects.title: React Resume Builder
projects.info: Application to help build quick and customized resumes. Create an account, log in, and add your information necessary for a resume. Built using React, Express, GraphQL, Material-UI, and Mongoose. Personally focused on the front end aspect of the project.

projects.title: Node.js README Generator
projects.info: A README.md generator created using Node.js

projects.title: MySQL Employee Tracker
projects.info: An employee tracker built using MySQL, running in Node.js. Add employees to MySQL database and view current employees.

projects.title: Progressive Budget Tracker
projects.info: An application that allows you to track your deposits and withdrawals whether or not you are connected to the internet.

projects.title: CMS Tech Blog
projects.info: A CMS style blog similar to a Wordpress site, where developers can publish their blog posts and comment on other posts as well. Following the MVC paradigm, using handlebars, and sequelize.

projects.title: Weather Dashboard
projects.info: A weather dashboard built using Javascript. This applicaiton can be used to check the weather in any given city. Input zipcode to get a weather report.

projects.title: Fitness Tracker Application
projects.info: A fitness tracker application built using NoSQL, Mongoose, and MongoDB. Use this application to keep track of your exercises and workouts.
